sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: European data confirms that 2023 was the hottest year on record, likely exceeding temperatures of any period in the last 100,000 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: On a mission to de-escalate tensions in the Middle East,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: the U.S. Secretary of State has held talks with the Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and other leaders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Anthony Blinken is seeking to prevent Israel's war on Hamas becoming a wider regional conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He also discussed the post-war governance of Gaza with Netanyahu and with the country's foreign minister, Israel Katz.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Blinken has just secured the backing of Arab nations and Turkey for the reconstruction of Gaza and is pushing Israel for its support. Yet some, including a minority within Israel, are calling for an immediate ceasefire before any plans for the territory's future are implemented. A small group made their feelings clear as Blinken met with Israeli leaders. But there seems no prospect of a truce soon, with Israeli forces pushing deeper into southern Gaza and intensive aerial bombardments continuing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The offensive has already left over 23,000 Palestinians dead and displaced nearly 85 percent of Gaza's population of 2.3 million.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Hamas's October 7 attack killed around 1,200 Israelis and militants took about 250 others hostage. Some 3,000 people gathering outside the European Commission office in the Polish capital

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Warsaw on Monday evening. They were calling on the EU to provide much-needed support and weapons to Ukraine. It was organized by the Euromaidan Warsaw initiative. Das sind meistens zivilisierte Personen, aber Europa schläft leider noch. Wir kommen heute hierher, um die Europäische Union ein bisschen zu erheben.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In der Zwischenzeit hat der deutsche Chancellor Olaf Scholz auf die Europäischen Staaten geruft, um die Unterstützung für die Ukraine zu steigen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: So wichtig unser deutscher Beitrag ist, er allein wird nicht ausreichen, um die Sicherheit der Ukraine dauerhaft zu gewährleisten. Ich rufe deshalb die Verbündeten in der Europäischen Union auf, ihre Anstrengungen zugunsten der Ukraine ebenfalls zu verstärken. Die bisher von der Mehrzahl der EU- Mitgliedstaaten geplanten Waffendieferungen für die Ukraine sind jedenfalls zu gering. And in Ukraine, soldiers in the Kharkiv region have urged the world not to forget their war against Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He says they are continuing to fight despite the harsh winter conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: After 12 months which saw new daily and monthly record highs,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: 2023 has been confirmed as the hottest year to date.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In its annual global report, Europe's Copernicus Space and Climate Data Agency says unprecedented temperatures from June onwards led 2023 to surpass 2016 as the warmest year so far.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The data charts the rise of global surface temperatures relative to pre-industrial levels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It shows daily averages briefly topped them by more than 2 degrees Celsius at certain points in the year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Across the world, the extreme impact was evident in extensive wildfires and sustained heat waves which may have been intensified by the El Niño weather phenomenon. Temperatures in Europe were above average for 11 months of the year and 2023 saw the warmest September on record.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The report also extrapolates that a 12-month period ending in January or February 2024 would exceed the 1.5 degrees Celsius global temperature rise level that the UN says would trigger irreversible climate change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The snow and extreme cold in Europe continue to complicate life for thousands of citizens throughout the continent, north and south.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Sweden recorded minus 43.6 degrees Celsius, its lowest temperature since 1999, while in Denmark temperatures have dropped to minus 20 degrees, causing traffic disruption.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This morning Danish car assistance companies received inquiries from more than 2,000 motorists who needed help.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: There have been traffic accidents in several places.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Snow and sub-zero temperatures on Monday also caused another day of disruption across Moldova, prompting authorities in the capital to close schools and suspend public transport.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Police have also warned drivers to take caution after assisting vehicles that veered off the roads amid the icy conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Spain's Ministry of Health will impose the mandatory use of masks in hospitals and health centers from Wednesday due to a flu wave. According to the latest report from the Carlos III Health Institute, the global incidence of respiratory virus infection is close to 1,000 cases per 100,000 habitants, yet the hospitalization rate remains under 30 cases per 100,000 habitants. The rule is transitory in nature, while the epidemic peak of flu and coronavirus infections last.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A happy ending in Slovenia, after divers rescued five people who'd been trapped underground for more than two days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: They'd entered the Krishnayamad cave on Saturday, but got stuck after heavy rain caused the subterranean water to rise fast.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The popular tourist destination features a string of emerald-coloured lakes and is only accessible by boat and raft. Rescue workers say the hours-long operation on Monday only became possible when the water levels dropped.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Officials say all five are in good spirits and were not in need of medical help.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: German farmers blocked the main motorway access roads in some parts of the country on Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's the start of a week of protests against the government plan to eliminate tax benefits for farmers. In Berlin, hundreds of tractors blocked the main access to the Brandenburg Gate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Protests planned for the next seven days include rallies that will disrupt traffic in several regions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Farmers are promising to block the roads for the next eight days despite the German government revising the 2024 budget that sparked these protests in the first place. The changes will see agricultural diesel subsidies reduced over the next two, bevor sie bis 2026 enden.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Aber die Landwirte sagen nutzt ja die Sonnenenergie hauptsächlich, verkauft als Abbau von klimaschädlichen Subventionen. Also das ist so abgrundverlogen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Die Regierungskoalition, die von Chancellor Olaf Scholz geführt wurde, hat die Landwirte im letzten Monat mit Plänen, die Fahrtax-Exemption für agri-Kultur-Aufbau und Tax-Breaks auf Diesel-Fuhrer, for agricultural vehicles and tax breaks on diesel fuel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Convicted mass murderer Anders Breivik appeared in court on Monday in a second attempt to sue the Norwegian state for allegedly breaching his human rights.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Breivik, a right-wing extremist who killed 77 people in a deadly rampage, appeared before a judge in Oslo claiming his solitary confinement since being imprisoned in 2012 amongst the inhumane treatment under the European Convention of Human Rights. A similar claim during a case in 2016 was accepted but later overturned. On the 22nd of July 2011 Breivik killed eight people in a bomb attack in Oslo before heading to a youth camp on Utøya Island, where, dressed as a police officer, he stalked and gunned down 69 more, mostly teenagers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He has shown no remorse for his attacks, which he portrayed as a crusade against multiculturalism in Norway.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: against multiculturalism in Norway.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The terrifying moments after an Alaska Airlines plane lost a door plug mid-flight last Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And on Monday, the airline said an inspection revealed some loose hardware visible on some of its aircraft.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Now, United Airlines says it too has found loose bolts on several of its planes of the same model.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Preliminary inspections of its aircraft on Saturday found what it described as installation issues including bolts on the door plug that needed additional tightening.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Following the Alaska Airlines incident, the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration grounded all Boeing MAX 9s installed with the same panel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The United Airlines find means the investigation will likely now be expanded to the whole fleet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It was the perfect lift off for the first United States attempt at a moon landing in over 50 years. But less than 24 hours into the mission, the company that developed the lunar lander it was carrying said it was abandoning its attempt to put the Peregrine spacecraft on the moon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Astrobotic Technology said while it had resolved an orientation problem preventing the craft from charging its batteries, the thrusters stopping an uncontrollable tumble would likely only operate for another 40 hours at the most.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It said it was aiming to get Peregrine as close to lunar distance as possible before losing power.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: South Korea's parliament on Tuesday passed a landmark ban on production and sales of dog meat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The bill would make slaughtering, breeding and sales of dog meat for human consumption illegal from 2027 and punishable by two to three years in prison.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It doesn't provide any penalties for eating dog meat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Dog meat consumption is a centuries-old practice on the Korean peninsula.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Recent surveys show that more than half of South Koreans want dog meat banned and that a majority no longer eat it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The average liter of bottled water has nearly a quarter million invisible pieces of ever-so-tiny

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: nanoplastics, detected and categorized for the first time by a microscope using dual lasers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Researchers at Columbia and Rogers University discovered about 10 to 100 times more nanoplastics than microplastics in bottled water. I mean whether we see it or not it's out there so it's better that we actually know how much is out there and what they are but I myself as a scientist I would want more data in terms of the toxicology study to actually know how harmful it would be to my own body." Nanoplastics are particles that are less than a micron in size.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A human hair is about 83 microns wide.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: To answer the big question as to whether nanoplastic pieces are harmful to our health, experts agree that the new study opens doors to better understanding of the potential risks.
